intro: Epilobium canum var. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf willowherb, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides. It is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Its morphology and habitat make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
